title_narrative: Humanitarian Enablers Programme
description_narrative:
INSO is a unique global humanitarian NGO established in 2011 and solely dedicated to enabling 
humanitarian safety and access in high-risk contexts. INSO was born from a need to establish a 
community resource and to promote good practice in the sector. The need for INSO field 
operations is self-identified by NGOs operating in each context. INSO makes its data and 
evidence-based findings available to registered partners and also uses them directly within its 
own public engagement to influence global discourse, systems and policies.

title_narrative: Delivery of safety cooperation and services to NGOs in Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger
description_narrative: Support to NGO safety coordination platforms in the Sahel region, to provide essential services and training to Sahel based NGOs, including high-quality, real time information and analyses on the security context in the Sahel, and sharing and coordinating this information with the NGO community to improve collective security and access.

title_narrative: Improved protection of relief personnel and improved  effectiveness of humanitarian action Mozambique
description_narrative:
Humanitarian organisations in Mozambique have access to timely, 
reliable, and high-quality safety services that help them plan, operate, 
and deliver aid more safely. 
Result 1: Information, Analysis and Advice – NGOs are provided with 
objective, credible, reliable, and high-quality security information 
analysis, and advice in a timely and appropriate manner.
Result 2: Security Management, Preparedness and Capacity 
Development – NGOs are supported in developing their security and 
crisis management preparedness and capacity through direct support 
and training.

title_narrative: Strengthening Humanitarian Safety III
sector_narrative: INSO provides a range of support services to non-profit humanitarian organisations including crisis support and coordination, capacity building, training information management, analysis advice, etc.
description_narrative: A 45-month project with a budget of 5.000.000 EUR from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands for the project titled 'Supporting Humanitarian Safety III' under Policy Objective 1 of the programme grant 'Strengthening the Humanitarian Sector 2024-2027': More effective application of humanitarian principles and international humanitarian law, enabling more humanitarian responders to do their work safely and access populations in need. To contribute to this policy objective, INSO will i) provide access to adaptive NGO safety and access platforms via field-based, remote and mobile interventions, ii) establish a common operating picture by expanding the Conflict and Humanitarian Data Centre's coverage and its application, iii) develop operational advocacy, research and coordination.

title_narrative: INSO - Provision of security information and management to NGOs - II
description_narrative: INSO provides safety, coordination, information, analysis, and training services to humanitarian NGOs in Nigeria.

title_narrative: Supporting Humanitarian Safety INSO-SIDA
sector_narrative: INSO provides free safety and security services to NGOs working for the benefit of the world’s most vulnerable people. This includes analysis and reporting, training, crisis coordination, safety and security alerts.
description_narrative:
The overall objectives of the Core Activities are:  

a) the relief and development of people in need anywhere in the world who are the victims of conflict, natural disaster, insecurity or crisis. 

b) the welfare and safety of people involved in the provision of humanitarian and development aid anywhere in the world.  

These objectives will be accomplished by:  a) providing dedicated safety & security services to organisations working to achieve the relief and development of people in need. b) promoting and facilitating a wider understanding of conflict and its impact on humanitarian and development safety. This mandates supporting activities such as policy support, advocacy, research and communications.

title_narrative: International NGO Safety Organisation - Improving NGOs’ Security Management Practices and Supporting Humanitarian Access Coordination in the DRC
description_narrative: Humanitarian and development aid organisations are assisted in fulfilling their own mandates through the provision of essential safety cooperation, information, and support services.

title_narrative: Delivery of safety cooperation and services to NGOs in Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger
description_narrative: This activity Delivery of safety cooperation and services to NGOs in Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger is a component of Sahel Humanitarian Emergency Response Programme  reported by FCDO with a funding type of 111 - Not for profit organisation and a budget of £2,433,627. This project benefits South of Sahara, regional. It works in the following sector(s): Relief co-ordination and support services.

title_narrative: Humanitarian Global Services (HGS) - support to International NGO Safety Organisation (INSO)
description_narrative: This activity Humanitarian Global Services (HGS) - support to International NGO Safety Organisation (INSO) is a component of Humanitarian Global Services reported by FCDO with a funding type of 111 - Not for profit organisation and a budget of £1,125,000. This project benefits Developing countries, unspecified. It works in the following sector(s): Material relief assistance and services.

title_narrative: Delivery of safety cooperation and services to NGOs in Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger
description_narrative: Support to NGO safety coordination platforms in the Sahel region, to provide essential services and training to Sahel based NGOs, including high-quality, real time information and analyses on the security context in the Sahel, and sharing and coordinating this information with the NGO community to improve collective security and access.

title_narrative: International NGO Safety Organization
description_narrative: To assist humanitarian and non-profit organizations in fulfilling their mandates though the provision of essential security coordination and information services that help to understand the operating environment and reduce the risks confronting their staff and operations.

title_narrative: INSO - Provision of security information and management to NGOs - II
description_narrative:
This activity INSO - Provision of security information and management to NGOs - II
 is a component of Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience Programme ( HARP) reported by FCDO with a funding type of 111 - Not for profit organisation and a budget of £1,292,999. It works in the following sector(s): Relief co-ordination and support services.

title_narrative: INSO - Improvement of Protection of Relief Personnel and Improved Effectiveness of Humanitarian Action
sector_narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility
description_narrative: INSO provide Humanitarian organisations in Mozambique access to timely, reliable, and high-quality safety services that help them plan, operate, and deliver aid more safely. This includes (1) information, analysis and advice; and (2) security management, preparedness and capacity development.

title_narrative: Support to INSO (Protect workstream)
description_narrative: A civil society organisation will be selected through a call for proposals, to deliver against the "Protect" Pillar of the Humanitarian Strategic Framework, under the HEP programme. The aim will be to enable the protection of the people most at risk in conflict and crises, including women and girls.

title_narrative: INSO - Provision of security information and management to NGOs
description_narrative: This activity INSO - Provision of security information and management to NGOs is a component of North East Nigeria Transition to Development Programme reported by FCDO with a funding type of 111 - Not for profit organisation and a budget of £1,588,999. It works in the following sector(s): Security system management and reform.

title_narrative: NGO Safety Programme- Provision of Security Information to NGO's
description_narrative: This activity NGO Safety Programme- Provision of Security Information to NGO's  is a component of Somalia Humanitarian and Resilience Programme (SHARP) 2018-2022 reported by FCDO with a funding type of 111 - Not for profit organisation and a budget of £1,125,000. It works in the following sector(s): Relief co-ordination and support services, Disaster prevention and preparedness.

title_narrative: Humanitarian Enablers Programme (HEP)
description_narrative: The programme will contribute to making humanitarian responses by FCDO and the international humanitarian system more effective as a core priority of the UK Government’s International Development Strategy (IDS). It will support specialised enabling services which are aligned to the three priorities of the Humanitarian Framework: independent data collection and analysis (prioritise); contributing to improved access and inclusion of vulnerable groups (protect); and strengthening early warning and risk management (prevent). The programme will deploy enabling services in rapid onset and protracted crises; complementing and informing the FCDO’s response and providing “global public goods” that multiply the impact of others.

title_narrative: Sahel Humanitarian Emergency Response Programme
description_narrative: To provide life-saving assistance to around six million crisis-affected and vulnerable people across five Sahelian countries, Mali, Niger, Chad, Mauritania and Burkina Faso. This support includes food and cash assistance for those suffering from food insecurity, therapeutic food and early detection of severe acute malnutrition, basic support to livelihoods through the provision of seeds and tools, animal food and animal vaccinations, improved access to safe water and hygiene, and emergency health and medicine. Research will be commissioned to build the evidence base for integrated nutrition assistance and to improve the understanding of required nutritional interventions in the Sahel.

title_narrative: Humanitarian Global Services
description_narrative: This programme will provide funding to a small number of leading international response organisations in the fields of safety, security, early warning, advice and risk analysis. This network of specialists provide global public goods which improve the overall effectiveness of humanitarian response to both rapid and slow onset humanitarian crises.

title_narrative: Mozambique Humanitarian Response Programme  2022-2027
sector_narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility
description_narrative: To provide lifesaving assistance to people in Mozambique affected by conflict and by climate disasters.  MHRP is based on evidence of need and gaps across the humanitarian sector.  It will reach 350,000 people with interventions in food security, nutrition, and protection.  Additionally, MHRP will reach 100,000 people each year with prepositioning of emergency stocks to respond to climatic events.

title_narrative: Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience Programme ( HARP)
sector_narrative: Ending violence against women and girls
Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility
Women's rights organisations and movements, and government institutions
description_narrative: In line with the G7 Famine Prevention Compact, Nigeria’s Humanitarian and Resilience Programme (HARP) will provide life-saving support to the most vulnerable and strengthen resilience, opening pathways to livelihoods. HARP will enhance overall effectiveness of the UN-led humanitarian response, including a focus on building Nigerian ownership.

title_narrative: Sahel Humanitarian Assistance and Protection Programme 2021-2028
description_narrative: The SHAPP will provide assistance and protection for the most vulnerable in geographic hotspots of most acute need in the Sahel. Hotspots are found across the region where consequences of conflict, including violations of international humanitarian and human rights law, are making pre-existing food insecurity and malnutrition worse. The SHAPP will address as many basic needs as possible of the most vulnerable including child protection, support to victims or survivors of gender based violence, food, nutrition, water and sanitation. Human rights and international humanitarian law will remain at the centre of the new programme by informing and driving SHAPP design and priorities.

title_narrative: North East Nigeria Transition to Development Programme
sector_narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
description_narrative: To deliver an effective response to the basic needs of vulnerable people impacted by the crisis in the North East of Nigeria. The programme will deliver humanitarian assistance in nutrition and food security; protection and Education in Emergencies; multi-sector support including health, water, shelter and livelihoods interventions; as well as enabling a more efficient response to the crisis, including strengthened government planning, budgeting and coordination; and risk management.

title_narrative: Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience Building in Somalia (HARBS) 2022-2028
description_narrative: To meet the most urgent humanitarian needs of conflict and disaster affected populations through provision of life-saving assistance and contribute to resilience building of benefitting households to withstand shocks.

title_narrative: Somalia Humanitarian and Resilience Programme (SHARP) 2018-2022
description_narrative: To meet the most urgent humanitarian needs of conflict and disaster affected populations through provision of life-saving assistance and contribute to resilience building of benefitting households to withstand shocks.
